definitions.definition: Relating to the position of something.
Having or pertaining to a value that is a function of its social desirability , as opposed to its utility .
Based on long-term strategy , on gaining and exploiting small advantages , and on analyzing the larger position, rather than calculating more immediate tactics .
An argument that is passed to a subroutine according to its position in the invocation code, rather than on its name; compare with named .

main_definition: Relating to the position of something.
secondary_definitions: ( economics ) Having or pertaining to a value that is a function of its social desirability , as opposed to its utility .
( chess ) Based on long-term strategy , on gaining and exploiting small advantages , and on analyzing the larger position, rather than calculating more immediate tactics .
( programming ) An argument that is passed to a subroutine according to its position in the invocation code, rather than on its name; compare with named .
